headline: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) Margin Miss Reinforces Value Narrative After $787M One-Off Loss
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) reported a net profit margin of 9.7%, falling below last year’s 14.5%, with results impacted by a one-off loss of $787.0 million in the twelve months through September 30, 2025. Revenue is projected to grow at just 3.7% per year and earnings at 8.6% annually, both trailing the broader US market averages of 10.1% and 15.6%. While the company is moving forward after a tough year that saw negative earnings growth, investors may look to its valuation, as shares trade at...

headline: KDP Q3 Earnings Meet Estimates, 2025 Sales Outlook Raised, Stock Up 8%
summary: Keurig's Q3 sales top forecasts, earnings meet estimates and a raised 2025 outlook sends shares up nearly 8%.

headline: Apollo's Kleinman on KDP Investment, PE Market and AI
summary: Apollo Asset Management co-President Scott Kleinman discusses why the firm and KKR are helping to finance Keurig Dr Pepper's purchase of JDE Peet's NV. Speaking on "Bloomberg Open Interest," Kleinman also comments on the current state of the PE market environment and AI.

headline: Keurig Dr Pepper secures $7bn investment to fund business split
summary: A $4bn portion of the investment will go towards a coffee pod manufacturing joint venture.

headline: Nelson Peltz Says $7B Take-Private Bid Would Let  Janus Henderson ‘De-Risk’

headline: KDP Q3 Deep Dive: Market Applauds Strategic Transformation and Segment Growth
summary: Beverage company Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ:KDP) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 10.7% year on year to $4.31 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.54 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.
